description.p: Poised between the worlds of the living and the dead, dhampirs retain their grip on life yet are endlessly tested by vicious hungers. However, it is possible for a dhampir to be restored back to life, but such an occurrence is exceedingly rare. The few cases that have been recorded in known history claim some sort of deific intervention as the catalyst for their transformation

With unique insights into the nature of the undead, many restored dhampirs become adventurers and monster hunters. Their reasons are often deeply personal. Some seek danger, imagining monsters as personifications of their former selves. Others pursue revenge against whatever turned them into a dhampir. And still others embrace solitude as penitence, ever striving to atone for the pain caused by the hunger to which they were once a slave.
You have the following racial traits.
Ability Score Increase. Increase one score by 2 and increase a different score by 1, or you increase three different scores by 1.
Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.
Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you gain this lineage.
Speed. Your walking speed is 35 feet.

Ancestral Legacy. If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
If you don’t keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

Reborn Resilience. You have resistance to necrotic damage. Furthermore, your mind is honed against the controlling influence of other minds; you have advantage on saves against charm and possession effects, and can add your Intelligence modifier to the total.

Spider Climb. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, at 3rd level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

Celestial Spark. When you fail a saving throw or skill check, or miss an attack roll, you can roll 1d4 plus your Intelligence modifier and add it to the total, potentially turning failure into success. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Alternatively if you have no uses left, you can spend a spell slot to immediately regain a use of this feature.

Blazing Renewal. A powerful light within you wards you against death. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to immediately rise back to your feet with a burst of radiant energy. You regain a number of hitpoints equal to twice your level, and all creatures of your choice within 10ft must succeed a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or take an equal amount of radiant damage and be blinded until the start of your next turn. Once you use this reaction, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.
Languages. Your character can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character.
If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
If you don’t keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
Notes: This trait's mechanics aren't implemented in the Aurora Builder. But you can emulate mechanics of this trait with following options:
Skill Proficiencies. You can recover lost skill proficiencies by selecting and equipping items from Additional Proficiency category of the Equipment section.
Speed. You can regain lost speed by selecting and equipping items from Additional Features category of the Equipment section.
